note.p: Career: Studied law; went abroad and began to write novels; MP for Maidstone (1837-1841); MP for Shrewsbury (1841-1847); MP for Buckinghamshire (1847-1876); Chancellor of the Exchequer (1852, 1858 and 1866); Prime Minister (1868, 1874-1880); Lord Privy Seal (1876-1878)
References: Vanity Fair 30 January 1869, 02 July 1878, 16 December 1879
G V R Born, FRS, 'The wide-ranging family history of Max Born' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 219-262
Notes: DNB has birth place as 6 King's Road, Bedford Row (now 22 Theobald's Road); BR gives Adelphi, Westminster
